The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: I'm not sure why everyone is hating on this game.  I feel like it is a solid 9.4.  I don't have to agree or disagree with something to enjoy it.  It's entertainment\, not a life altering experience.The game adds to the first game by adding additional movements\, weapons\, and minor tweaks.  The only reason I can't give it a higher score is the constant fights get to be monotonous.  Some parts felt way too drawn out.  The first game moved at a nice pace\, and this game is a much slower pace that gets a little frustrating at times.As far as the twists and turns the game took\, I enjoyed and hated them.  I didn't like seeing Ellie as the bad guy or Abbey as someone I empathized with and actually felt was more \"mature\" in the game.  There sometimes is no happy ending\, and The Last of Us Part 2 didn't give us one.  It gave a great insight into forgiveness\, love\, bleakness\, and the failures of being human.I can only imagine people are upset by Ellie's sexual orientation\, the death of Joel\, or the characterization of Ellie in the game.  Who cares if she is a lesbian.  Absolutely non-issue for this game or any game.  I think everyone is bent over Joel dying early on and Ellie is no longer a helpless child\, but a vengeful adult.The game is extremely violent and I'm not sure how I feel about it.  It was uncomfortable in a few parts and I was constantly wanting to make different decisions contrary to Ellie's decisions.  I didn't feel I needed to do that with Abbey.Overall\, a really great game and it will stand up as one of the best on the Playstation 4 or any game this generation.… Expand
